contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an act of worship and giving honor to someone. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
Standing up was a sign of honoring God will listening to his message. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: The king got up out of his seat

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here, to anoint with oil is a symbolic action that represents appointing a person to be king. Alternate translation: "to appoint a king to rule over all of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: to anoint a king over them

contextId.occurrenceNote: To anoint someone with oil is a symbolic action that appoints a person to be king. Alternate translation: "to appoint me as your king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: to anoint me as king over you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an act that shows mourning or great sadness. Alternate translation: "he tore his clothes from grief" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
"lay with their faces to the ground." This is a sign of respect and honor, but it also shows their fear of Yahweh. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
